page.title: 03Trowlesworthy Ecology
page.content: Much of the area is unfenced moorland with rough grazing,bracken and gorse amongst the clitter of boulders and with a small amount of heather and whortleberry on the higher ground. There are also extensive patches of blanket bog. Trees are sparce,mainly hawthorn associated with field boundaries and in one derelict field. In this section of the moor wild life is unmolested,because ther is no hunting and very little intrusion by modern man. Vegetation does not grow easily on china clay waste,so much of the southern section of the area is barren. The climate is typical of upland exposed to southwest winds,which bring a high rainfall and frquent mists. It is raw cold in winter.
